facts.text: Austin FC was founded in what year? (2018)
In which MLS season did Austin FC begin play? (2021)
What is the name of Austin FC's home stadium? (Q2 Stadium)
Austin FC is the first major professional sports league team in which U.S. city? (Austin, Texas)
Before Austin FC, which Austin-based soccer team was relocated to become MLS side Orlando City SC? (Austin Aztex)
On what date did the Austin City Council grant authority to negotiate a stadium lease with Precourt Sports Ventures? (August 15, 2018)
Who designed the Austin FC crest? (The Butler Bros)
What is the signature color of Austin FC's badge? ("Bright Verde")
Who were the first head coach and Sporting Director of Austin FC, respectively? (Josh Wolff and Claudio Reyna)
Who was Austin FC's first signed player? (Rodney Redes)
Who was named the first club captain of Austin FC? (Alexander Ring)
Austin FC played their first MLS match on April 17, 2021, against LAFC.
Diego Fagúndez scored Austin FC's first goal in the club's history.
Cecilio Dominguez was Austin FC's first Designated Player.
Jon Gallagher scored Austin FC's first home goal and the first MLS goal at Q2 Stadium.
Sebastián Driussi became the first player to score 10, 20, and 30 career goals for Austin FC.
Owen Wolff was Austin FC's first homegrown player signing.
In 2022, Austin FC set an MLS record by scoring 10 goals in their first two matches of the season.
Diego Fagundez scored Austin FC's first U.S. Open Cup goal.
Austin FC won their first trophy, the Division 1 Copa Tejas, on July 16, 2022.
Moussa Djitte scored the first hat trick in Austin FC history.
Austin FC clinched their first playoff berth with a 3-0 home win against Real Salt Lake.
Austin FC won their first MLS playoff game in a penalty shootout against Real Salt Lake after a 2-2 score following extra time.
Austin FC advanced to the Western Conference Final for the first time but lost to LAFC 3-0.
Austin FC announced the debut of their reserves team, Austin FC II, in MLS Next Pro for 2023.
Claudio Reyna resigned as the Sporting Director of Austin FC but stayed as a Technical Advisor before eventually leaving the position.
Rodolfo Borrell took over as Sporting Director for Austin FC in June 2023.
Austin FC qualified for their first CONCACAF Champions League in 2023.
Austin FC was eliminated from the 2023 U.S. Open Cup after a 2–0 loss to the Chicago Fire.
Austin FC competed in their first regional competition at the 2023 Leagues Cup but failed to advance to the round of 16.
Austin FC failed to qualify for the 2023 MLS Cup Playoffs, leading to changes in the front office announced on October 8, 2023.
Rodolfo Borrell took over overseeing scouting and player personnel for Austin FC in 2023 and hired five new scouts in Europe and South America.
Josh Wolff was released from his position as Austin FC's head coach on October 6, 2024, after the team failed to make the playoffs for the second consecutive year.
Nico Estévez was announced as the new head coach of Austin FC for the 2025 season after the November 2024 FIFA window.
Austin FC's stadium at McKalla Place, which seats 20,738, hosted its first game on June 19, 2021.
The lease for the stadium at McKalla Place, owned by the City of Austin and privately financed by Two Oak Ventures, was signed on December 19, 2018.
Austin FC announced plans for a $45 million, privately funded training facility, the St. David's Performance Center, on November 13, 2019.
McKalla station, serving Austin FC's stadium, opened on February 24, 2024, as part of Project Connect.
Austin FC has sold out all 54 home games since their debut, holding the longest active streak in MLS as of the date of the fact.
In February 2024, Austin FC added an armadillo jocktag to the team's uniform in a deal with Eddie Wilson.
For the 2021 and 2022 seasons, Nexstar Media Group was Austin FC's broadcast partner, with games appearing on KNVA, KXAN, and KBVO.
From 2023, every Austin FC match has been available via MLS Season Pass on the Apple TV app.
Austin FC's English-language radio rights are held by Alt 97.5 FM, with Lincoln Rose as the announcer, and KLQB serves as the flagship Spanish radio station.
Austin FC is owned by Two Oak Ventures, which is led by CEO Anthony Precourt.
Actor Matthew McConaughey is an investing partner in Two Oak Ventures, the ownership group of Austin FC.
Austin FC launched their reserve team, Austin FC II, which began play in 2023 as part of MLS Next Pro's Western Conference.
David Rodríguez became the first Austin FC II player to sign a short-term contract with the first team on May 17, 2023.
Valentin Noël became the first Austin FC II player to appear in a first team match in July 2023.
The Austin FC Academy, the first professional soccer academy in Austin, TX, began play in August 2019.
Austin FC Academy became part of MLS Next in the fall of 2020.
Ervin Torres was the first Austin FC Academy player called up for a U.S. Youth National Team in April 2022.
Anthony De Anda was the first Austin FC Academy player to sign a professional contract with Austin FC II on January 23, 2023.
Burton became the first Austin FC Academy product to sign a professional contract with the first team on January 10, 2024.
Austin FC won the Copa Tejas in 2022 and 2023.
Austin FC II entered the first round of the 2024 U.S. Open Cup following changes made by U.S. Soccer.
Austin FC did not qualify for the 2025 Leagues Cup due to CONCACAF format changes.
Austin FC was announced as a Major League Soccer (MLS) franchise in 2018 but did not begin play until 2021.
Austin FC became the first major league sports franchise in Austin, as officially announced on January 15, 2019.
The Columbus Crew SC was considering relocation to Austin in 2019 before the Cleveland Browns owners emerged as potential buyers, ensuring the team remained in Columbus.
Austin FC's first signing was Paraguayan winger Rodney Redes, announced on July 6, 2020.
Alex Ring was named the captain of Austin FC.
Matthew McConaughey was among four locals who joined the Austin FC ownership group on August 23, 2019.
Claudio Reyna departed New York City FC to join Austin FC, with his departure announced alongside the promotion of David Lee to Sporting Director at NYCFC.
Austin FC is a team that competes in Major League Soccer (MLS).
Austin FC has a reserve team named Austin FC II that competes in MLS Next Pro.
The head coach of Austin FC is Estévez.
Austin FC's supporters' groups include Los Verdes and Austin Anthem.
Tampa Bay Mutiny, Miami Fusion, and Chivas USA are former MLS teams that have ceased operations.
The MLS Cup, Supporters' Shield, and All-Star Game are notable competitions and events associated with Major League Soccer.
The Generation Adidas Cup is associated with Major League Soccer.
The CONCACAF Champions Cup and Campeones Cup are international competitions that MLS teams participate in.
The U.S. Open Cup and Canadian Championship are domestic cup competitions that MLS teams compete in.
The "Fraser v. Major League Soccer" case occurred in 2002.
Austin FC's kit manufacturer from 2021 to 2024 was Adidas.
The shirt sponsor for Austin FC from 2021 to 2024 was Yeti.
The sleeve sponsor for Austin FC from 2021 to 2024 was Netspend.
Starting from 2025, Siete Foods became the shirt sponsor for Austin FC.
Brad Stuver is the player with the number 1 jersey for Austin FC and plays as a goalkeeper (GK).
Mikkel Desler, a player from Denmark (DEN), wears the number 3 jersey and plays as a defender (DF) for Austin FC.
Ilie Sánchez, from Spain (ESP), wears the number 6 jersey and plays as a midfielder (MF) for Austin FC.
Jáder Obrian from Colombia (COL) wears the number 7 jersey and plays as a forward (FW) for Austin FC.
Brandon Vázquez is designated as a Designated Player (DP) for Austin FC and wears the number 9 jersey.
Myrto Uzuni from Albania (ALB) is a Designated Player (DP) for Austin FC and wears the number 10 jersey.
Diego Rubio, hailing from Chile (CHI), wears the number 21 jersey and plays as a forward (FW) for Austin FC.
Josh Wolff served as the head coach from July 23, 2019, to October 6, 2024.
Davy Arnaud served as the interim head coach from October 6, 2024, to November 20, 2024.
Nico Estévez has been serving as head coach since November 20, 2024.
In the 2022 season, Sebastián Driussi was the top goalscorer with 25 goals.
The team's average attendance from 2021 to 2025 remained constant at 20,738.
Sebastián Driussi scored a total of 51 goals across the seasons listed.
